meanings.definition: The quality of being honorable or worthy of respect.
meanings.sent1: Her honorabilities shone through when she helped the elderly lady cross the street.
meanings.sent2: The community admired his honorabilities for always standing up for what is right.
meanings.sent3: His honorabilities were so impressive that even the grumpy cat couldn't help but purr in approval.
meanings.sent4: The honorabilities of the old oak tree reminded me of the strength and resilience of our ancestors.
meanings.sent5: The knight's honorabilities were like a bright beacon guiding others in times of darkness.

meanings.definition: A group of people who are honorable or respected.
meanings.sent1: The honorabilities gathered to discuss ways to improve the community.
meanings.sent2: In times of need, the honorabilities of the town always came together to support one another.
meanings.sent3: The honorabilities decided to have a dance-off to settle their differences in a fun way.
meanings.sent4: The honorabilities stood united like a mighty fortress against any challenges that came their way.
meanings.sent5: The honorabilities' presence at the event added an air of dignity and grace to the proceedings.
